newsitem.title: INDIA: India rupee ends steady, forward dlr premiums slip.
newsitem.headline: India rupee ends steady, forward dlr premiums slip.

text.p: The Indian rupee moved in a narrow band to end Friday steady at 35.82/83 against the dollar, dealers said.
The day was dominated by State Bank of India (SBI) which came in successive waves to mop up an estimated $100 million, they said.
SBI began buying at 35.830 and stepped up its bids to 35.835 in a second round. "Thereafter banks went and sold to SBI at 35.830," a dealer said.
SBI came around again to buy at 35.835 in the afternoon.
"After this, he was comfortably placed and started bidding down," the chief dealer at a Bombay bank said about SBI.
The rupee continued its climb against the forward dollar, propelled by exporter sales and signals from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) to cut interest rates, dealers said.
Premiums fluctuated during the day on intra-day profit-booking. The six month annualised forward premium closed the day at 3.46 percent compared with the previous close of 3.79 percent.
Exporters were seen selling far forwards to get premiums above 4.0 percent, dealers said.
